questions.question: Why were the Navigation Acts considered to be a main cause of the American Revolution?

choices.answer: Colonists resented Britain because they restricted trade.
Colonists did not want to pay taxes without representation.
The Navigation Acts placed a tax on all imported goods.
None of these

questions.question: Why did the Proclamation of 1763 create tension between Great Britain and the colonies?

choices.answer: Speculators purchased land out west and were denied access.
It put a tax on tea.
Colonists needed the king's permission to move west.
It put a tax on all paper products.

questions.question: Why did the relationship between Britain and the colonies begin to deteriorate?

choices.answer: The Proclamation of 1763 restricted freedom.
Colonists did not want to pay for the French and Indian War.
Colonists didn't believe in taxation without representation.
Colonists didn't like British troops being stationed there.

questions.question: How did Parliament respond to word that the colonies were on the verge of rebellion?

choices.answer: They sent peaceful diplomats to Boston.
They did not respond and did not feel threatened.
They sent three regiments of troops into Trenton.
They sent two regiments of troops to Boston.

questions.question: How did colonial leaders use the Boston Massacre to their advantage?

choices.answer: It was used to discourage the colonists from revolting.
They hoped it would build support for Parliament.
It was used as propaganda for support against the British.
All of these

questions.question: Why did Adams and the Boston Sons of Liberty dump 342 chests of tea into Boston Harbor?

choices.answer: They were protesting the Stamp Act of 1765.
They were protesting the Sugar Act of 1764.
They were protesting the Coercive Acts of 1774.
They were protesting the Tea Act of 1773.

questions.question: According to the Declaration of Independence, to which three freedoms are each person entitled?

choices.answer: life, liberty, and the pursuit of happiness
life, happiness, and freedom of speech
happiness, territory, and liberty
life, liberty, and the acquisition of territory

questions.question: On which holiday did George Washington and the Continental Army cross the Delaware River?

choices.answer: Thanksgiving
Halloween
Christmas
Easter Sunday

questions.question: During the Battle of Trenton, against whom did the Continental Army fight?

choices.answer: French troops
Hessian mercenaries
Native Americans
All of these

questions.question: Why was the Battle of Saratoga important?

choices.answer: It was a major victory for the Americans.
It was a huge loss for the Americans.
It was a major victory for the British.
It held little significance during the American Revolution.

questions.question: Why did the French not support the Americans publicly until after the Battle of Saratoga?

choices.answer: They didn't think the Americans could win until that moment.
That battle proved the British would win once and for all.
They did not want to create an international crisis.
They always believed the Americans would defeat the British.

questions.question: The signing of which document officially made the United States an independent nation?

choices.answer: Treaty of London
Treaty of Yorktown
Treaty of Versailles
Treaty of Paris
